description: From Late Latin, neuter of practicus (“practical”), from Ancient Greek πρακτικός (praktikós, “of or pertaining to action, concerned with action or business, active, practical”), from πράσσω (prássō, “I do”).

entries.meaning: (US) A college course designed to give a student supervised practical knowledge of a subject previously studied theoretically.
(US) A science exam in which students are questioned about specimens or other objects placed in front of them.
